name: Affix
content: Used to fix the element in a specific area, it is common to fix navigation bar

children.name: API

offsetTop.Description: trigger when the offset is  specified at the top of the viewport

offsetBottom.Description: trigger when the offset is  specified at the bottom of the viewport

children.info: If `offsetTop` and `offsetBottom` are both set , `offsetBottom` has priority

name: Alert
content: Alert is used to provide eye-catching information.

children.name: Guide
children.content:
-  Content should be as simple as possible to make it easier to be read.
-  The number of buttons should be less than 2 in order to keep logic simple.

rounded.Description: determines whether the corners are rounded or not

closable.Description: determines whether the Alert can be closed or not

name: Badge
content: Badge normally appears in the upper right corner of the notification or avatar with eye-catching appeal, which is typically used to display the number of unread messages.

children.name: Guides
children.content:
-  Badge is used to prompt for new messages, which is placed in the upper right corner or right side of the text or icon.
-  Badge can display the specific number of new messages.

count.Description: The number of messages to show

dot.Description: Whether to show red dot without number

showZero.Description: Whether to show badge when count is zero

name: BlockHeader
content: This is a block header.

name: Breadcrumb
content: Breadcrumb is used to provide a hierarchical navigation structure and mark the current position.

children.name: Guide
children.content:
-   There're more than 2 levels of hierarchy。
-   Users need to be told where they are.
-   Function of navigating upwards is required.

name: Button
content: Button. Basic style and basic status are provided.

children.name: Guide
children.content:
-   Style can be set by `type`.
-   Size can be set by `size`.
-   Decorate statuses like `'block'`, `'disabled'` and `'loading'` are supported.
- If `href/target` are provided, Button will be rendered as an a tag while style and status are supported as well.

block.Description: whether to be displayed as a block

outline.Description: determines whether the background is transparent

bordered.Description: determines whether the border is displayed

href.Description: Optional, the component will be rendered as an a tag instead of a button tag if this property is set

target.Description: Optional, used together with href, which is the target property of the a tag

name: Card
content: Card is used for information displayed on the card container.

children.name: Guides
children.content:
-   Control whether to display title by `title`
-   Provide interactive operation through `action`
-   Customize content style through `bodyStyle`

style.Description: custom style of the card container

bodyStyle.Description: custom style of the content area

name: Cascader
content: Cascader is used for cascade operation, e.g. cascade location selection.

children.name: API

loadMore.Description: Function to load data dynamicly, must return Promise

changeOnSelect.Description: Wether trigger change once sth. is seleted

placeholder.Description: The placeholder text of input box

children.info:
-   The source data can be fully passed with `options` or dynamic loaded.
-   The `root` parameter is data object of current clicked element, and `stage` parameter is the level number when load data throught `loadMore`.
-   The `isLeaf` paramter is used for `loadMore`. It controls wether click on the node triggers a request.

children.name: Guides
children.content:
- Checkbox is a [controlled component][https://facebook.github.io/react/docs/forms.html#controlled-components]. You need to set the callback function `onChange` outside the component to handle the changes of `value`.

- `value` supports any type of value, inclueding Referrence Type.

value.Description: The value of the components, which is used in `CheckboxGroup`

onChange.Description: The callback function that is triggered when the checkbox is changed

children.name: Checkbox Group API

value.Description: The value when checkbox is checked, which is required

isValueEqual.Description: The funtion to judge whether the value is equal

onChange.Description: The callback function that is triggered when the checkbox group is changed

children.info: [controlled-components]: https://facebook.github.io/react/docs/forms.html#controlled-components

name: ColorPicker
content: ColorPicker is used for color selection and supports multiple formats.

presetColors.Description: Simple version of custom color array

onChange.Description: The callback function that is triggerd when color is changed

wrapperClassName.Description: The  custom classname of trigger's parent node

onChange.Description: The callback function that is triggerd when color is changed

name: CopyButton
content: Copy button will copy the specified text to the system clipboard when clicked.

children.name: Guides
children.content:
- When you need to copy some text, you can use this component.
- This component may fail in some older version browsers since it doesn't rely on Flash.

text.Description: The next need to be copied

onCopySuccess.Description: The callback function that is triggered when copy successful. If this property is string, it will show in `Notify.info`.

onCopyError.Description: The callback function that is triggered when copy failed. If this property is string, it will show in `Notify.error`.

name: DateRangeQuickPicker
content: DateRangeQuickPicker is used for time range selection, it has 2 quick options which points previous 7 days and previous 30 days.

children.name: Usage Scenarios
children.content: As a filter control above list pages.

name: DatePicker
content: Time pickers, provides basic time choosing functionality.

children.name: Guides
children.content:
- Four pickers：`DatePicker`, `MonthPicker`, `WeekPicker` and `RangePicker`.
- `DatePicker` and `RangePicker` can use `showTime` to allow time selection.
- Date formats can be customized using `format`, you can find formating details at the end of this page.

onClick.Description: Callback when click on a value

children.name: DatePicker

disabledTime.Description: Callback to check if specific time is disabled

disabledDate.Description: Callback to check if specific date is disabled

name.Description: Name attribute of the input node

onBeforeConfirm.Description: Confirm callback, return `true` to allow, `false` to abort

onBeforeClear.Description: Clear callback, return `true` to allow, `false` to abort

children.info:
- `disabledDate` will be passed a date object as argument, return true if the date should be disabled. Using `max` and `min` can cover most use cases.
- If both `min`/`max` and `disabledDate` are present, `disabledDate` takes precedence.
- Return value of `disabledDate` is an object, there are three functions within this object: `disabledHour`, `disabledMinute` and `disabledSecond`.
- Only date format is allowed in `format`, time format will be appended when `showTime` is `true`.

disabledDate.Description: Callback to check if date is disabled

children.name: RangePicker

disabledDate.Description: Callback to check date is selectable

disabledTime.Description: Callback to check time is selectable

children.info:
- Recommended `type` is `split`.
- When `showTime` is `true`, the `min` and `max` string must have time part, e.g. `2017-01-01 11:11:11`.
- `disabledTime` has an additional argument `type` like in `DatePicker`, its value is `start` or `end`.
- `onClick(val, type)`, the `type` is the same as `disabledTime`.

content.Output: 星期日, 星期一 ... 星期五, 星期六

name: Design
content:
H5 page editor, build your H5 pages in a WYSIWYG way.

⚠️ Warning：The `Design` component exported by Zent uses `react-dnd-html5-backend`'s `HTML5Backend`. Each React component tree can have only one instance of `HTML5Backend`. Please use `zent/lib/design/Design` to replace the default export from Zent if you are using `HTML5Backend` somewhere else. There two components are almost the same, except the one in `zent/lib/design/Design` does not depend on `HTML5Backend`.

children.name: API

defaultSelectedIndex.Description: Default selected index in value array

confirmUnsavedLeave.Description: Show a confirm dialog if there're unsaved changes

cacheId.Description: Cache id, must be used with `cache`

cacheRestoreMessage.Default: 提示：在浏览器中发现未提交的内容，是否使用该内容替换当前内容？

children.name: Design.group
children.content:
Declaration：`group(name: string): object`

`Design` supports component grouping in add component area, all you have to do is insert `Desgin.group(groupName)` to the right place in your `components` array.

```js
[
  config,

  Design.group('分组1'),
  componentA,
  componentB,

  Design.group('分组2'),
  componentC,
  componentD
]
```

children.name: Design Instance Methods
children.content:
* `design.validate(): Promise`, trigger a validation, resolves only if there's no erro.
* `design.markAsSaved()`, tell `Desgin` data has been saved.

children.name: stripUUID
children.content:
There's a `stripUUID` method on `Design` instance, you can use this method to strip all internal ids used by `Design` before sending data to server. This may help reduce data size.

Note: calling `stripUUID` before sending data to server is optional.

children.name: How to Implement new Design Component?
children.content:
Each Desgin component are divided in two parts: Preview and Editor.

Preview is just a component which accepts `{ value: any, globalConfig: any, design: object }` as props and renders a UI with these props.

It is a little bit complex about Editor component. You are recommended to extend the `@youzan/design/lib/base/editor/DesignEditor` base class, this class has some useful methods you can use(e.g. `onChange` event handlers).

Editor has these props:

`{ value: any, onChange: func, showError: boolean, validation: object, design object }`

- `validate(value): Promise` You should resolve an error object if there're errors
- `props.design` There're some useful methods on this prop

A editor component must have these static properties: 

`designType, designDescription, getInitialValue, validate`

children.name: Example

name: Dialog
content: Dialog is used for opening a floating layer.

children.name: Guides
children.content:
-  Imperative, call `openDialog` function.

-  Component-based, show/hide the dialog  through `visible` prop.

closeBtn.Description: visibility of the close button at the upper right corner

maskClosable.Description: wether click on the mask is to close the dialog

children.name: openDialog

dialogId.description: Optional, the id of dialog. The dialog can be closed throuth `closeDialog(dialogId)`.

parentComponent.description: Optional, the reference of dialog's parent, used to correlate the `context`

children.info:
`openDialog(options: object): function`

**`options` can contain all props above in addition to `visible` as well as the following parameters：** 


A `ref` function passed to `openDialog` can provide a reference to the instance, **`ref` in string format is non-supported.**

> The return value of `openDialog` is a function which can close the dialog manually, and close the dialog with this function won't trigger `onClose`. **It is recommended to use `closeDialog`.**

children.name: closeDialog
children.content:
`closeDialog(dialogId: string, options: object): void`

If `options.triggerOnClose` is `true`, `onClose` will be triggered when the dialog is closed.

children.name: Specify the width of the Dialog
children.content:
Set a `style` prop on Dialog can specify its width, e.g. `style={{ width: '600px' }}`.

By default the pop-up window width will adapt its content, meanwhile it has a minimum width and maximum width.

name: Dropdown
content:
A component pops down.

We don't provide a specific component called `Dropdown`. The function of `Dropdown` component is a subset of function of `Popover` component. This doc decribes how to use `Popover` to implement a `Dropdown`.

children.name: Usage
children.content: Generally, the component is used for dropdown menu.

children.name: API
children.info: Please refer [the api doc of `Popover`](popover#api).

children.name: About position
children.content:
It's recommanded to use `AutoXxxYxx` provided by `Popover` for positioning. E.g. it's positioned below the lower left corner, but the position will be adjusted if it's out of the screen.

Alternative ways for positioning can be refered to [the   position doc of `Popover`](popover#position%20api)。

name: Form
content:
1. [Guides](#guides)
2. [The validations of form](#the-validations-of-form)
3. [The format of value](#the-format-of-value)
4. [The operations of form](#the-operations-of-form)
5. [Others](#others)
6. [The internal realization of form](#the-internal-realization-of-fo)
7. [Other instructions](#other-instructions)
8. [API](#api)

children.name: `Form`
children.content:
- `Form` provides three kind of layouts: `inline`，`horizontal`， `vertical`.
- To use the `Form` component, you must first wrap it with `createForm` method, which will inject `zentForm` into the form and provide various operations of field and form. See more details in demos and [`zentForm` API] (#zentform).

children.name: `Field`
Package multiple elements
children.content:
When a `Field` needs to contains multiple elements, it is recommended to assemble the values of multiple elements into one object and passed it to the `Field` component. When using `getControlGroup` is not possible to satisfy your package requirements, you can wrap the component yourself and change the value of the field by calling the `onChange` function passed in by the `Field` component.

⚠️Ps：Calling the `onChange` function passed in by `Field` will override the original value. You can pass the second parameter as `{merge: true}` to `onChange` function, which will partially override the original value.

children.name: The usage of form validations
Different timing when the validations are triggered
children.content: The default timing of validations is when the value of field changes. You can change the timing when the validation is triggered by specifing `validateOnChange`, `validateOnBlur`. For example, the field will trigger the validation in blur when set `validateOnChange` to be `false` and `validateOnBlur` to be `true`. Notice that these property are typically for input fields.

children.name: Asynchronous validations
children.content:
Asynchronous validations is usually triggered on blur. If you need to manually trigger asynchronous validations in a custom component, you need to call `props.onBlur (event)` yourself.  `value` can be passed to the function directly as the `event` parameter or an attribute of `event`.

If you submit a form without operating the fields that have asynchronous validations, these asynchronous validations will not be triggered by default. Using the built-in `handleSubmit` method for submitting will help to trigger the asynchronous verifications which have never been triggered.

children.name: The format of `value`
children.content: The `Form` component provides` format` and `nomalize` methods for formatting` value`. The timing of their implementation is detailed in [The life-circle of value in Field](#the-life-circle-of-value-in-fi)。

children.name: The operations of form
children.content:
- `Form.createForm` helps injecting the `zentForm` property into a component, which providing various methods for manipulating form and field, such as getting the values of form, resetting the values and so on. See more details in [zenForm API](#zentform);
- The submission process of form is also encapsulated in `Form` component. You can encapsulate the asynchronous commit process in a function and **return a Promise object **. Then `Form` components will call the `onSubmitSuccess` method and the `onSubmitFail` methods according to the results of the Promise object and maintains the updates of the `isSubmitting` property (`isSubmitting` is available via `zentForm.isSubmitting ()`).

children.name: The internal realization of form
children.content:
The core components of form are as follows:

- The `createForm` function: It is used to build a higher-order component which maintains an instance of all the form elements (the` Field` component) in the form. The subcomponent will get various methods of manipulating form and form elements by injecting `zentForm` into the subcomponents through `props`.
- The `Form` component: As the toppest skeleton of the entire form, `Form` is a simple package of the `<form>` tag. The `Form` also defines the default class which provides base style.
- The `Field` component: It is a higher-order component which packages various fields, such as `Input`, `Checkbox`, `Select` and various custom components. The component will maintains the value and validation error of the field. The `Field` component also passes the encapsulated callback function of `onChange`, `onBlur` and the properties that are required by fields to form element components, such as `value`, `error` and so on.

See more details in [API](#api).

children.name: Package custom fields
children.content:
- The display of `Field` is entirely controlled by the `component` property which is passed into the component. This component can receive all the properties which are passed in from `Field` (including some implicit properties constructed in `Field`, which is described in detail in [`Form.Field` API](#form-field).

- For some popular form components in `zent`, the `Form` component provides several build-in components through the `getControlGroup` function. If there are some special requirements in your product design, you can also directly use the `getControlGroup` to package your own custom field components. See more details in the demo [Package multiple elements](#package-multiple-elements).

- **If you need to display multiple form elements in a single `Field`, you can use an object which is consists of all these values and pass it into the `Field` as the property `value`. See more details in the demo [Package multiple elements](#package-multiple-elements).**

children.name: The life-circle of `value` in `Field`
children.content:
- The initial value of the `Field` needs to be passed in by specifying `value`. The life-circle of `value` is shown below: 

```
pass value into Field ---> format the value using format() ---> use the value after fomatting to render
															 ↑                                     |
															 |                                     ↓
															 |                      The user changes the value by operationZ
															 |                                     |
															 |                                     ↓
		pass the value after normalizing to form for sumitting <--- format the value using normalize()
```

- If the `value` passed into the `Field` is a dynamic value, the life-cicle will restart after the value is changed externally.

children.name: **`Form`**

vertical.Description: Whether to use the vertical layout

horizontal.Description: Whether to use the horizontal layout

inline.Description: Whether to use the inline layout

onSubmit.Description: The callback function that is triggered when the form is submitted.

children.info: `Form` is a simple package of the `form` tag. It provides a default class name.

children.name: **`Form.createForm`**

formValidations.Description: The property is used to add custom validation methods which can be passed extra parameters when used in validations.

onChange.Description: The callback function that is triggered when any fields in the form. The parameter of this function is the object of all the values of fields.

onSubmitSuccess.Description: The callback function that is triggered when the form submission is successful. The parameter of this function is the return result of the promise in submit function.

onSubmitFail.Description: The callback function that is triggered when the form submission is failed. The parameter of this function is an instance of `SubmissionError` or `undefined`.

getFormValues.Description: The function to get all the field's values in the form

getFieldError.Description: The function to get the error messages of the specified field, which will return null when there is no error.

setFormDirty.Description: The function to set all the fields to be non-native state, which helps to display all the unshown errors when submitting the form

setFieldExternalErrors.Description: The function to set external error messages, such as the validation error from the server. The parameter `error` of this function is an object with keys being the names of fields and values being the corresponding error messages.

setFieldsValue.Description: The function to specify the value of a certain field.

resetFieldsValue.Description: The funtion to set all the values of all the fields as the initial values or the specified values.

initialize.Description: The funtion to set the initial values of the form.

isValid.Description: The function to get the state whether all of the form fields have been validated.

isSubmitting.Description: The function to get the state whether the form is sumitting.

isValidating.Description: The function to get the state whether the form is in asynchronous validation.

isFieldDirty.Description: The function to get the state whether the field has been changed.

isFieldValidating.Description: The function to get the state whether the field is in asynchronous validation.

children.name: **`Form.Field`**

component.Description: The real component of the field which will determine how the field is displayed. The value of this property can be string (standard html tag name) or React node.

value.Description: The initial value of the field

normalize.Description: The normalization function of value when the field is changed or on blur.

format.Description: The format function of value before the field's rendering which will not affect the value stored in the form.

onChange.Description: The callback function that is triggered when the field's value is changed. This function is encapsulated in `Field` so that the custom field components should call `props.onChange()` function by yourself.

onBlur.Description: The callback function that is triggered when the field is on blur. This function is encapsulated in `Field`.

onFocus.Description: The callback function that is triggered when the field is on focus. This function is encapsulated in `Field`.

validationErrors.Description: The error massages of the validations.

validateOnChange.Description: Whether to trigger the field's validations when the field is changed.

validateOnBlur.Description: Whether to trigger the field's validations when the field is on blur.

clearErrorOnFocus.Description: Whether to clear the error messages when the field in on focus.

asyncValidation.Description: The asynchronous validations which should return a Promise object.

isActive.Description: Whethe the field is input and has been on focus

error.Description: The first error message of the field. It is null when there is no error.

errors.Description: The array of the error messages. It is an empty array when there is no error.

children.info:
All the field components that need to maintain `value` need to be wrapped by the `Field` component.
The following `props` will be passed into the `Field` component. All the `props` expect for `component` (including the custom `props`) will be passed to the field component defined in `component`:


In addition to the above parameters, the `Field` component implicitly passes the following props to the wrapped field component:


##### **Get the instance of component in `Field`**

You can get the instance of the field component through adding a ref in `Field` and calling the `getWrappedComponent` function.
```
<Field
	ref={ref => { this.field = ref }}
	component={XxxComponent}
	...
/>

const component = field.getWrappedComponent();
```

children.name: **`Form.getControlGroup`**

className.Description: The extra class name which will be added to the control-group and will override the style of the child component.

helpDesc.Description: The help description of the field.

notice.Description: The import notice of the field.

required.Description: Show a red asterisk before the label when this propoerty is true.

children.info:
`getControlGroup` is a function that is used to quickly wrap a custom component. It returns a stateless functional component that satisfies common layout and style requirements (left label, right form element). At the same time, it supports to display the field's error message.

The packaged components support the following properties which can be pass from `Field`:


##### **Get the instance of `Control`**

Similar to getting the instance of the component of `Field` above, you can call the `getControlInstance` method.

```jsx
const component = field.getWrappedComponent().getControlInstance();
```

children.name: **Built-in validation rules**

required.Parameters: Any. Passing `true` or any other value means this rule in effect. This instructions apply to all the following rules.

isExisty.Required: Whether the value is not `null` or not `undefined`.

matchRegex.Required: Whether the value matches the regular expression.

isEmail.Required: Whether the value is an email.

isUrl.Required: Whether the value is a website link.

isNumeric.Required: Whether the value is a numeric type.

isInt.Required: Whether the value is a integer type.

isFloat.Required: Whether the value is a decimal type.

isLenght.Required: Whether the length of the strging of the array is the specified length.

equals.Required: Whether the value is equal to the specified value

equalsField.Required: Whether the value is equal to the value of other field

maxLength.Required: The maximum length of the string or the array

minLength.Required: The minimum length of the string or the array

children.info: You can use it directly in the `validations` property of `Field`. See more details in the demo [The usage of form validations] (#the-usage-of-form-validations). The built-in rules are as follows:

name: Grid
content:
Grid component

The function of the component is similar to the function of [Table](table) component. `Grid` is implemented by `<table>` tag, while `Table` is implemented by `div` and `flex` layout.

onChange.Descripition: callback fires when columns change, filtering and sorting included

sortBy.Descripition: the field which rows are sorted accoring to, should be one of keys for columns

emptyLabel.Descripition: Text to be displayed when there's no data

loading.Descripition: determines whether data is being loaded or not

onRowClick.Descripition: callback fires when a row is clicked

ellipsis.Descripition: whether ellipsis should be displayed when content overflows (nowrap of columns needs to be set)

children.name: onChange function declaration
children.content:
onChange will throw an object, which includes parameters about the change part of pagination.

```js
{
	current, // {Number} the current page
	sortBy, // {String} the key which rows are sorted according to
	sortType, // {String} ['asc', 'desc', ''] the way to sort
}
```

name.Description: key for the corresponding data(recommanded to be set). Nested description like `a.b.c` is supported

className.Description: class name of the column title

colSpan.Description: span of columns. It won't be rendered if the value is set to 0

fixed.Description: whether columns fixed or not. The value can be `left` `right` `true` (`true` is same to `left`)

onCellClick.Description: callback fires when a cell is clicked

nowrap.Description: whether to wrap, true by default

selectedRowKeys.Description: keys of selected rows by default

onSelect.Description: callback fires when a check changes

getCheckboxProps.Description: function to get properties of the checkbox

pageSize.Description: Number of items to be displayed per page

name: Icon
content: A semantic icon library.

children.name: Guide
children.content:
-   Part of icons has solid and outline two versions, which the difference is `-o`. e.g. `shop`(solid) and `shop-o`(outline).
-   Naming rule: `[icon name]-[variant]-[outline or not(o)]`.

name: InfiniteScroller
content: Infinite scrolling widget

children.name: Guides
children.content: - Used to load content continuously as the user scrolls down the page.

hasMore.Description: if pass true, it will call loadMore function

loadMore.Description: loadMore function, first argument is a callback to stop loading animation effect

initialLoad.Description: whether it should be call loadMore function when it initialize

useWindow.Description: if pass true, it will listens window scroll event, or it will listens it's DOM element scroll event

useCapture.Description: whether to capture event when scroll event triggers

loader.Description: showing content when it is loaded

offset.Description: it will loads data when the distance threshold has been reached

children.name: loadMore
children.content: When it is a async loading, it is expected that the return of loadMore function is a Promise that is used to control loading show. or you have to stop loading by yourself with the first param as callback from loadMore function

name: Input
content: A input widget for buiding forms in React, based on raw input. you can enter content through mouse or keyboard.

children.name: Guides
children.content:
- Using Input, with prefix or suffix.
- Combining with another widgets, such as combined into a search box.

children.name: API

readOnly.Description: whether is only read or not

initSelectionStart.Description: The 0-based index of the first selected character

initSelectionEnd.Description: The 0-based index of the character after the last selected character

children.name: focus
children.content:
`focus(): void`

Manual focus to the input box

children.info: _except for the attributes above, input widget supports all attributes that React support for input_

children.name: select
children.content:
`select(): void`

Select all text in input

`select(selectionStart?: number, selectionEnd?: number): void`

Select the content between selectionStart and selectionEnd

name: Layout
content: Nestable grid system of zent, based on `float` and `calc(width)`

name: Loading
content: Loading is used for indicate loading state of section.

children.name: Guides
children.content: -  You can use this component to reduce users' anxiety when the page is rendering or some data is loaded asynchronously.

float.Description: Whether from the document flow, set to `true` in global mode

name: Menu
content: Menu, can be used to provide navigation.

onClick.Description: Callback fires when a node of menu is clicked

disabled.Description: whether to disable the menu item

overlayClassName.Description: custom class name of the pop menu

className.Description: custom class name of the submenu item

prefix.Description: custom prefix of the submenu item

children.name: FAQ
children.content:
- A click event callback function, whose parameters are event and key(which is the key property of the node), is used as a unified agent.
- When the `key` property is not set for the MenuItem, a unique identify of the node (starting from 0) is generated automatically in order and hierarchy, which will be saved on the `index` property as the second argument of the `onClick` function.
  When the `key` property is set manually, the property will be copied to the `index` property and will override  the unique identify generated. It's recommanded to manually set the `key` property to a proper value of MenuItem in the condition that the Menu is not complex.
  
  ```
	<Menu>
		<MenuItem>   -------- 'item_0'
		<SubMenu>
			<MenuItem> -------- 'item_1_0'
			<MenuItem> -------- 'item_1_1'
		</SubMenu>
		<MenuItem>   -------- 'item_2'
	</Menu>
	```

name: Notify
content: Display a notification at top of the viewport.

children.name: Guides
children.content: - Display a brief message

children.name: API
children.info:
- `Notify.success(text: node, duration?: number, callback?: () => ()): number`
- `Notify.error(text: node, duration?: number, callback?: () => ()): number`

`Notify.success` and `Notify.error` return an id, which can be used by `Notify.clear(id)` to close the specific notify instance;


- `Notify.clear(number?: id): void`

If no `id` is passed to `Notify.clear`, it will close all notify instances that are active.

- `Notify.config(options): void`

`duration` is the only supported parameter in `options`, it is used to set `Notify` duration globally.

name: NumberInput
content: A input widget for entering number through mouse or keyboard

children.name: Guides
children.content: - When you enter number, using numberInput is more convenient

min.Description: the minimum value in the range

max.Description: the maximum value in the range

name: Pagination
content: Pagination component

children.name: Guide
children.content: - The total number of items to display need to be known.

pageSize.Description: number of items to be displayed per page

maxPageToShow.Description: max number of pages to be displayed

children.name: About `pageSize`
children.content:
pageSize property supports 3 types of structure:

- number: `30`

- arrayOf(number): `[10,20,30]`

The initial value is 10.

- `[10, 20, { value: 30, isCurrent: true }]`

The initial value is 30.

children.name: Component Mechanism
children.content:
- The component is composed of core-pagination and zent-pagination.

The former is the core pagination component. The later simulates the interaction of www, based on the former.

- There's a built-in parser to parse input to `renderData`.

children.name: Input
Output

name: Pop
content: A floating card opened by clicking, hovering or focusing.

children.name: Guides
children.content:
- Triggers: click, hover and focus
- Can be used as tooltip
- Supports arbitary content in popup

children.name: API

position.Description: Pop content position, naming rule: content position relative to trigger + arrow position relative to Pop

onBeforeShow.Description: Callback before Pop has opened, only user actions can trigger this callback, setting `visible` won't trigger this callback

onBeforeClose.Description: Callback before Pop has closed, only user actions can trigger this callback, setting `visible` won't trigger this callback

visible.Description: Pop switch to controlled mode if this prop is set, must be used with `onVisibleChange`

closeOnClickOutside.Description: Close Pop when click outside trigger and content

isOutside.Description: Callback to determine if click is outside of Pop
Callback to determine if mouse is outside of Pop

quirk.Description: Switch to quirk mode, you don't have to move from inside to outside to trigger a close in quirk mode

children.name: None
children.content: When using this trigger, `onConfirm` and `onCancel` will not close `Pop` automatically, you are responsible for controlling `visible` to close `Pop`.

children.name: withPop HOC
children.info:
This HOC exposes some useful `Pop` methods.

Possible senario: close `Pop` within its content.
`Pop` has some additional props depends on different triggers.

children.name: centerArrow
children.content: `Pop` aligns edges of its content and trigger by default, the distance between the arrow and content edge is fixed except when `position` is set to `'*-center'`. The arrow will appear outside of trigger's edge when trigger size is small. When this happens you can set `centerArrow` to `true` to always align arrow to trigger's center.

children.name: onConfirm and onCancel
children.content:
These two callbacks supports asynchronous mode, buttons will change into loading state when pending on result.

- If return value is a `Promise`, `Pop` will close on `Promise` `resolve`.
- If callback has parameters, it will be called with a `close` argument, `Pop` will not close until you call `close`.

name: Popover
content:
Common trigger pop widget, you can customize postion、trigger method、display style.

The widget supports nested pop

**The widget do not support style, if you need bubble-like tips component, please use `Pop`.**

children.name: Guides
children.content:
* If `Pop` widget do not meet your needs, you can achieve custom trigger pop by using `Popover` 
* Can be used as `Dropdown`

children.name: API

cushion.Description: optional, position offset, generally it reserves a space for some icon like array

display.Description: optional, the display property specifies the type of box used for an HTML element.

onShow.Description: optional, the callback after pop shows

onClose.Description: optional, the callback after pop closes

onBeforeShow.Description: optional, the callback before pop opens, only triggered by user's operation, setting `visible` outside will not call

onBeforeClose.Description: optional, the callback after pop closes, only triggered by user's operation, setting `visible` outside will not call

containerSelector.Description: optional, pop's parent node CSS selector

visible.Description: optional, manual control pop's show or hide, must be used with `onVisibleChange`

onVisibleChange.Description: optional, the callback when manual control, must be used with `visible`,  only triggered by user's open/close operation

children.name: Trigger.Click

autoClose.Description: optional, whether to auto close pop when click `outside`

isOutside.Description: optional, to determine a node is `outside` or not, click outside to close pop. default trigger and the node outside pop is `outside`

children.info: The `data` in isOutside includes two attributes ：`contentNode` and `triggerNode`。

children.name: Trigger.Hover

showDelay.Description: optional, the duration before layer open (in milliseconds), during this time, if you move mouse out of layer, pop will not open

hideDelay.Description: optional, the duration before layer close (in milliseconds), during this time, if you move mouse out of layer, pop will not close

isOutside.Description: optional,to determine a node is `outside` or not. default trigger and the node outside pop is `outside`

quirk.Description: optional，quirk mode，in this mode, mouse is not required to move out trigger and layer when close triggers

children.info: The `data` in isOutside includes two attributes：`contentNode` 和 `triggerNode`。

children.name: Trigger.Focus
children.content: Display when it gets focus， close when it loses focus, no params

children.name: Trigger.Base

contentVisible.Description: whether ccurent pop is opened or not

onTriggerRefChange.Description: when ref changes, callback is executed. and it is only needs when you rewrite render function

children.info: All trigger's base class,  implement custom trigger need to inherit this class, you have rewrite `getTriggerProps` method to add trigger event. and you can control pop's open/close in event handle function.

children.name: Position API
Position.create
withPopover high-level component

children.info:
`onBeforeShow` and `onBeforeClose` will return a  `Promise`，`Popover` will open/close after `Promise` resolve，if  `Promise` reject, open/close opreation will stop.

If you do not use `Promise`, `onBeforeShow` and `onBeforeClose` also supports two arguments `callback` and `escapse`, you have to manual call `callback` to open/close in `onBeforeShow` and `onBeforeClose`. manual call `escape` to stop open/close opreation.


`onBeforeShow(callback: ?function, escape: ?escape): ?Promise`


Every kinds of trigger has it's own API to control component behavior, custom trigger can specifies it's parameter.

name: Portal
content: Portal widget

children.name: Guides
children.content: Portals provide a first-class way to render children into a DOM node that exists outside the DOM hierarchy of the parent component.

children.name: API

children.Description: required parameter, only supports one child

selector.Description: optional parameter, render child DOM node
selector.Alternative: legal CSS selector or certain DOM node

visible.Description: optional parameter, whether to render child

className.Description: optional parameter, custom extra class name

css.Description: optional parameter, extra css style. such as, `{ 'margin-left': '10px' }`

children.name: withESCToClose

visible.Description: required, the Portal's original attribute is selectable

onClose.Description: required, callback is trigger when ESC enter

children.name: withNonScrollable

visible.Description: required, the Portal's original attribute is selectable

children.info: `Portal` provides some high-level component(HOC)，including some logic are generally used in popover

children.name: principle
children.content:
- The widget is mainly used to insert it's `child` to given DOM node, and it is removed from DOM when component is `unmount`.
- A certain degree of repaint occurs when any props are modified, and `children`, `selector`'s change will trigger component `unmount` to `mount`; when other props is modified, only existing DOM node attributes update.

children.name: known issues
children.content:
- Using string `ref` on Portal's `children` throws error, to avoid this question, you can use functional `ref`. the reason is Portal's `chilren` has no owner, if you want to read more detail about this issue, click [ Here](https://github.com/facebook/react/blob/v15.0.2/src/renderers/shared/reconciler/ReactRef.js#L18). Using string `ref` on Portal's `children` is also not encouraged by official react team.

- On `15.0.2` version,  React has a bug that the `context` rely on `state` does not update in some case(refer to example: 02-context), please wait React version updates

name: previewImage
content: This component is used to preview images.

children.name: Guide
children.content:
-  	It's used to zoom thumbnail.
-   Next image and previous image can be selected.
-   Images can be rotated.

name: Progress
content: Progress represents the current progress and status of the operation.

children.name: Guides
children.content:
-  Progress is suitable for long-time operations, which shows the current progess and status of the current operation.
-  Progres can display the percentage of the operation progress.

strokeWidth.Description: The width of progess bar, unit: px

width.Description: The radius of the cicrle progress bar or the total length of the strip progess bar

normalColor.Description: The color of the progress bar

successColor.Description: The color of the progress bar and the status icon whe the progress's status is successful.

exceptionColor.Description: The color of the progress bar and the status icon whe the progress's status is in exception. When this property is not specified, it will use the property `normalColor`.

name: Radio
content: `RadioGroup` is a [controlled-component][https://facebook.github.io/react/docs/forms.html#controlled-components]. There must be a `onChange` callback dealing with changes outside.

value.Description: Used to set the currently selected value

isValueEqual.Description: Optional, a function to determine whether values is equal

value.Description: Compare according to the, determine if selected

name: SearchInput
content: SearchInput is a special Input with search box.

children.name: API
children.info: The API of SearchInput is consistent with Input, `type` not included.

name: Select
content: Select is a drop-down selection component with variety functions.

children.name: Guides
children.content: Component mainly made up of Select, Popup, Trigger three modules.

children.name: Select
children.content: Core controller, the main responsibility is to format data and data transfer between Popup and Trigger.

children.name: Popup
children.content: Options list pop-up layer, is mainly responsible for display options, data filtering control.

children.name: Trigger
children.content:
- Triggers, exposed to the user, can be configured via the trigger prop.
- Core triggers are SelectTrigger and InputTrigger.
- TagsTrigger is based on the InputTrigger extended multi-select function.
- Users can expand or develop their own trigger.

children.name: API

value.Description: Selected value, when tags type, can be passed into the array

optionText.Description: Custom options display text's corresponding key, e.g. `{ id: 1, name: 'Doc' }` needs `optionText="name"`

optionValue.Description: Custom options value's corresponding key, e.g. `{ id: 1, name: 'Doc' }` needs `optionValue="id"`

filter.Description: Filter conditions, set to open the filter function

maxToShow.Description: When there is a filter, set the maximum number options to display

autoWidth.Description: Whether to automatically set the width of pop-up layer equal with input-box's width

children.name: Trigger
children.info: Trigger can pass parameter changes by changing the props of Popup by calling `this.props.onChange({...})`.
If both data and children are used, data will cover the children, mainly in order to receive asynchronous data directly change the data property to change the options.

name: SKU Selector
content: It is a widget for sku select

children.name: Guides
children.content: You can create a editable page with a variety of goods and services

onFetchGroup.Description: async get choosable sku array, such as "color"、"size"

onFetchSKU.Description: async get one sku value, such as "red"、"blue"

onCreateGroup.Description: create a new sku key, such as "constellation"

onCreateSKU.Description: create a new sku value, such as "virgo"

onChange.Description: the callback will return current sku value when sku changes

children.name: Utility methods
children.content: In order to easily manipulate sku date, sku widget supports some utility methods

children.name: SKU.flatten(sku, items, options)
children.info: Using cartesian product, transform tree value to platten array

name: Slider
content: You can select a value by dragging or clicking `Slider`.

children.name: Guides
children.content:
- Support a single slider and double slider.
- Can be used with `Input`.

children.name: API

onChange.Description: The callback function that is triggered when the slider is changed

range.Description: Whether the range selection can be used or not

dots.Description: Whether the value of slider can only be selected from label values or not

children.info: **Ps.** When setting `range`, you should set `value` as an array of length 2. The array entry must be a number. Property `dots` must be used with `marks`.

name: Steps
content: Steps is suitable for operations that need to be guided step by step.

current.Description: The curren step which starts from 1. When this property is not passed, `current` is 0 and steps is in status of `wait`.

sequence.Description: Whether to use the default step number or not, especially for steps of card type and breadcrumb type.

onStepChange.Description: The callback function that is triggered when the steps in cliked and changed, especially for steps of card type and breadcrumb type.

children.name: Steps.Step

title.Description: the title of each item in steps

description.Description: The details of each item in steps (This propterty is not supported in steps of card type and breadcrumb type. )

children.info: `Steps.Step` is each item of the `Step` component.

children.name: Known issues
children.content: This component didn't deal with the situation where there is only one step. In fact, you shouldn't use this component when there is only one step.

name: Sweetalert
content: Sweetalert is a function used for arouse a Dialog rapidly.

children.name: Guides
children.content: -  Sweetalert has no custom option, use Dialog instead if needed.

type.Description: dialog type, will show an icon on the left side of title if this prop is set.

children.name: Sweetalert.confirm

type.Description: dialog type, will show an icon on the left side of title if this prop is set.

children.info:
- The returned value of `Sweetalert.alert` and `Sweetalert.confirm` are functions which can be used to close the dialog manually.
- If `onConfirm` return a `Promise`, the corresponding button will stay loading when `Promise` is pending; The dialog won't be closed when `Promise` rejected, and will be closed if `Promise` resolved.
- If `onConfirm` has no parameter and returned a `false`, the dialog won't be closed.
- If `onConfirm` has one parameter `close`, it need to be triggered manually to close the dialog.

name: Swiper
content: Swiper is used for a group of flat content circulated.

dots.Description: wether to show the page button below

dotsColor.Optional: any css color value in string

arrows.Description: wether to show flip button on both sides

name: Switch
content: Switch is a switching selector。

children.name: Guides
children.content:
-  Switch is recommended to be used when you need to indicate the switch between two status.
-  itching `Switch` will trigger the status change directly.

onChange.Description: The callback function that is triggered when the value of `checked` is changed.

checkedText.Description: The text to show when the switch is on.

uncheckedText.Description: The text to show when the switch is off.

children.name: Guides
children.content: - Both page screening and sorting will trigger `onChange` callback.

columns.Description: All data needed of each column

datasets.Description: Data need to display of each row

sortBy.Description: Field which used to sort, should be one element's key of columns

emptyLabel.Description: Prompt text when list is empty

getRowConf.Description: The configuration function for each line, return a configuration object `{canSelect, rowClass}`

batchComponentsAutoFixed.Description: Whether to automatically fix batch operation

autoStick.Description: Whether to stick the head to the window automatically

autoScroll.Description: Whether to click the page automatically scroll to the top of the table

pageInfo.Description: Paging information corresponding to the table

children.name: Special declaration of getRowConf
onChange
children.content:
onChange will throw an object containing pagination and sorting parameters：

```js
{
	sortBy, // {String} based on what to sort
	sortType, // {String} ['asc', 'desc'] sort way
	current, // {Number} current page
}
```

title.Description: Name shows on thead of each column

name.Description: Primary key of each column, affects sorting and filtering

width.Description: The width of each column, can be relative or fixed value. e.g. 20%/100px

needSort.Description: Whether support sorting, this column must has key.

isExpanded.Description: Whether to expand the current row

expandRender.Description: Render function of expanded row's additional content

name: Tabs
content: Tabs is used to switch different view in one page.

children.name: Tabs

activeId.Description: The id of the active tab

onTabChange.Description: The callback function that is triggered when the tab is active

onTabDel.Description: The callback function that is triggered when the tab is closed.

onTabAdd.Description: The callback function that is triggered when adding tab.

candel.Description: Whether the tab can be deleted.

canadd.Description: Whether the tabs can add more tab pannels.

tabs.Description: The config of tabs when not using Panel.

tab.Description: The label of the tab which corresponding to this panel.

id.Description: The id of the tab panel.

name: Tag
content: Tag is suitable for marking and sorting。

children.name: Guides
children.content:
-  Tag is usually used as special marks or sorting marks.
-  You can add multiple tags for one item.
-  The text in tag should not more than four words.

outline.Description: The style with colorful border and transparent backgound.

rounded.Description: Whether the tag is rounded or not

closable.Description: Whether the tag can be closed

onClose.Description: The callback function that is trigged when the tag is closed

name: Tree
content: Tree widget is used to build and manipulate trees. such as files, organization structures, geographic infomation

children.name: Guides
children.content:
- Supports two types of data structure, nested tree and array.
- The widget only display input data, but not change itself.

data.Description: required, input data, identified by dataType

render.Description: you can customize function to render tree , the parameter is node data (includings children tree)

foldable.Description: whether to support item show and hide

onCheck.Description: when you click checkbox, callback function will call, params is a array includes all nodes id array

disabledCheckedKeys.Description: default forbidden choosen node id array

onExpand.Description: after node expands, callback is trigger

autoExpandOnSelect.Description: node auto expands when you select it

onSelect.Description: the callback when you choose tree node

isRoot.Description: plain data, to determine whether the node is the api of the root node

children.name: data

parentId.Description: parent Id (`dataType="plain"` it works), roort node is 0 or undefined

isLeaf.Description: whether is leaf node or not

children.info: Except for key-value below, you can add attributes on anynode,  the callback will get entire data that user input

action.Description: required，click callback，the parameter is children tree

shouldRender.Description: is it need to update，return true/false

name: Upload
content: Image uploader.

maxAmount.Description: Limit number of images, 0 means no limit

silent.Description: No notification about sucesss/failure when set to true

onProgress.Description: Progress callback when uploading local image

filterFiles.Description: Filter local files, supports Promise as return value
